revisited this game after playing it blind on release 3 years ago not a bad game all things considered though i can 100 understand a lot of the criticisms for it be warned that the spiked keychain is bugged if you equip it to jkr and use an abilityattack that causes jkr to overheat the game crashes doesnt appear this will be fixed but id like to be proven wrong if you havent played a lot of jrpgs in the past its a good game to get into the genre

i havent finished this game yet but so far so good i dont really get why this game has mixed reviews but i personally like it the artstyle is bright and beautiful the story is pretty decent and the turnbase combat has a cool twist to it like you can parry crit hit and bend time to your advantage so it keep you engage most of the time unlike traditional turnbase games so yeah im really having fun with this game so far

the mixed reviews on this one are baffling to me and its criminal that i almost skipped it as a result cris tales borrows a lot of welcome aspects of chrono trigger and super mario rpg but puts a very unique spin on mechanics both in and out of combat the art style is legitimately novel and the story is really solid i also appreciate that its a reasonable scope and length strongly recommended for jrpg fans

charming art and soundtracks unlike its other aspect combat felt sluggish and repetitive after a short while with most of the later skills being basically useless difficulty is nonexistent story at its core can be good but the way they show the cutscenes not the animated ones were awkward and emotionless in short good idea bad execution

just for referencei am a 56 year old man old school gameri got the game as part of a pack of games ive played all the great jrpgs from back in the day so when i saw cris tales i did not think i would like it and i was righti loved it  what a fresh innovative gamethe graphics are fresh and vivid the story great interesting fight system and just a fun game to play if you love new takes on story telling cris tales is your game
